title: Streaming to Multiple Computers on Your Network with Multicast on VLC

steps.title: Install VLC media player with full features.
steps.content: Install VLC media player with full features. When installation is complete, open the program.

steps.title: In the Menu bar, click “Media” and “Open Network Stream”.
steps.content: In the Menu bar, click “Media” and “Open Network Stream”.

steps.title: In the Open Media windows, click on “File”.
steps.content: In the Open Media windows, click on “File”.

steps.title: Click "Add" and select the file you want to stream.
steps.content: Click "Add" and select the file you want to stream. Near the bottom of the screen, click the drop arrow next to "Play" and select "Stream."

steps.title: In the Destinations box, click on the drop menu and chose “HTTP.”
steps.content: In the Destinations box, click on the drop menu and chose “HTTP.” Click on “Add".

steps.title: In the stream output window, make sure port number is 8080.
steps.content: In the stream output window, make sure port number is 8080. Check that no other software uses the port 8080.

steps.title: Open VLC media player, click on "Media," and select "Open Network Stream".
steps.content: Open VLC media player, click on "Media," and select "Open Network Stream".

steps.title: In the "Network" tab, enter the IP address of the media server, as well as the port number.
steps.content: In the "Network" tab, enter the IP address of the media server, as well as the port number. Click "Play."

steps.title: On the streaming vlc server:
steps.content: On the streaming vlc server: Do not check the "display locally" box. It will stay silent, you will not hear anything, however, the stream is sent out.

steps.title: On the listening VLCs:
steps.content: On the listening VLCs: Tighten the buffering/caching: Start with a 20ms caching and increment by 10 until the stream is free of cutting out. In the startup phase it will always cut out a lot, but the stream will stabilize after about 5 to 10 seconds and be smooth.

steps.title: To listen on your sending computer:
steps.content: To listen on your sending computer: Open a second vlc client and listen to the stream as you do on all the others, same caching/buffering values.

steps.title: Note that all caching values seem to need to be the same.
steps.content: Note that all caching values seem to need to be the same.
